title.native: 獄・さよなら絶望先生

description:
A continuation of Zoku Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei, with more stories revolving around Nozomu Itoshiki, the extremely pessimistic or despairing teacher, and the students of class the 2-H, who are each hilariously abnormal in their own unique way except for the one relatively normal girl who hates being called normal.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description:
__Height:__ 156cm

__[Twitter](https://x.com/rarirurestn)__ |__ [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ai_nonaka/)__ | __[Aoni Profile](http://www.aoni.co.jp/actress/na/nonaka-ai.html)__

Non-anime roles:
- Honoka - Azur Lane (VG)

__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/inoue-marina.html) | [Blog](http://yaplog.jp/marinavi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Mari_navi) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/17179.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marina_Inoue) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%95%E4%B8%8A%E9%BA%BB%E9%87%8C%E5%A5%88)

A voice actress and singer. She is signed onto Sony Music Japan's Aniplex division as a music artist. Formerly under the agency Sigma Seven, she transferred to Aoni Pro in 2022.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Pallas - Arknights (VG)
- Elysia - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Yanqing - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Helm - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Zhu Yuan  - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/3doO4OZ07IlQnOo)

A Japanese gag manga artist. His most famous works are Go!! Southern Ice Hockey Club, Katte ni Kaizou and Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei. His other major works include √P Root Paradise, Sodatte Darling!! and The Sun's Soldier Poka Poka.  

Former Assistants: [Kenjiro Hata](https://anilist.co/staff/100074), [Maeda-kun](https://anilist.co/staff/172154/Maedakun) (also known as MAEDAX, MAEDAX G, MAEDAX Roman)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新房昭之) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akiyuki_Shinbo)

Akiyuki Shinbou is a Japanese director, producer, animator and storyboard artist. He joined Studio One Pattern in 1981. He made his directorial debut with [Metal Fighter Miku](https://anilist.co/anime/1175/) in 1994. He joined Shaft in 2004. He has received the 11th Tokyo Anime Award and the 2011 Newtype Anime Award for Best director for his work on the acclaimed anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/).

Shinbou was born in Fukushima Prefecture. After high school, he attended Tokyo Designer Institute before entering the anime industry.

After graduating from Tokyo Design Institute, Shinbou worked as an animator for the 1981 anime series [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/). Shinbou participated with Studio Pierrot in 1990 as an episode director in [Musashi](https://anilist.co/anime/8065/). His first full directorial debut was however the previously mentioned, with Metal Fighter Miku. He continued his early directional career with several OVA series in the late 90's. Shinbou participated with Seven Arcs starting with [Triangle Heart: Sweet Songs Forever](https://anilist.co/anime/176/) in 2003 and then became director for 2004's spin-off [Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha](https://anilist.co/anime/76/).

His style in particular became noticed during his episode direction work on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392/)'s Dark Tournament arc. After seeing Shinbou's stylized presence, the new president of Shaft, [Mitsutoshi Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/151830/), approached Shinbou with the desire to make Shaft a distinctive studio among animation companies. In an interview, Kubota cited [Le Portrait de Petit Cossette](https://anilist.co/anime/514/) and [The SoulTaker](https://anilist.co/anime/1048/) among Shinbou's most distinctive products that caught his eye.

His work at Shaft has been characterized by extensive experimentation within the visual medium of animation, and often includes pictures taken from real life cut into scenes, as well as art shifts, beat panels, kabuki sound effects, textures that remain stationary when the textured object moves, showing symbols or defining parts of a character in place of characters during dialogue, written text in place (in opposition to dialogue), precise use of fan service, and "head-tilting", a style known as a Shaft specialty.

He says that the reason he sticks with Shaft is due to their system and professional capacity, which make his expression of direction much easier. The so-called "Team Shinbou" includes himself, [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and [Shin Oonuma](https://anilist.co/staff/101753/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Official Website](http://www.okenkikaku.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/puku1048) | [Blog](https://o-ken.blog.so-net.ne.jp/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大槻ケンヂ)

Kenji Ootsuki is a Japanese rock musician and Seiun Award winning writer from Tokyo. His musical career began in the late 1970s to early 1980s. He is the vocalist of [Kinniku Shoujo Tai](https://anilist.co/staff/280201), Tokusatsu, Underground Searchlie and Karate Bakabon.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1219713270149341184)

Originating from Studio Comet, where he initially worked as a production assistant. He is friends with, and often collaborates with [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and both [You](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/). All three of them worked at Gainax together in the '90s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1219713270149341184)

All three of them worked at Gainax together in the '90s.

Rapbit, or Rapbito, is a rap artist who became popular on Nico Nico Douga and YouTube for doing covers of game and anime songs, and self composed songs.  He major debut on beginning 2009 with album All Day, All Night, and had second album called RAP MUSIC on March 11, 2009.  He loves reading manga.  He got married on January 18, 2011.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/龍輪直征)

He began his career in 2000 as an animator at Studio Giants; in 2004, he began working for [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/), where in 2011 he made his debut as a director with [Katte ni Kaizou](https://anilist.co/anime/10191/). In 2016 he left Shaft and went freelance. In 2019, he started working for [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/龍輪直征)

He began his career in 2000 as an animator at Studio Giants; in 2004, he began working for [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/), where in 2011 he made his debut as a director with [Katte ni Kaizou](https://anilist.co/anime/10191/). In 2016 he left Shaft and went freelance. In 2019, he started working for [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/).

In 2016 he left Shaft and went freelance. In 2019, he started working for [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀山俊樹)
Tou Fuyashi is a collective pseudonym for [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/)'s staff.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/y_kaele)

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin, he joined an adult game brand (スタジオルクス) which he soon left. He entered [Studio Pastoral](https://anilist.co/studio/299/Studio-Pastoral) after which he started working on [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft) shows and became part of the main staff for most of their works.
Freelancer formerly from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).

**Birthplace:** Fukuoka, Japan

Yukihiro Miyamoto, occasionally nicknamed Otokomatsuri, is a Japanese animator and director. He started at animation studio Vega Entertainment, and later joined Shaft. He is best known for directing Puella Magi Madoka Magica and its subsequent film trilogy alongside Akiyuki Shinbo, the latter trilogy which subsequently garnered ¥2 billion, making it a box-office success.

Miyamoto described himself as being a "heretic" at Shaft-- someone who, in a company of many differing directors, is only good at doing "plain work", and isn't particularly original or creative. Shinbo described Miyamoto in a similar way, but said that he was more like a professional craftsman who leaves their mark in places that cannot be seen.

**Birthplace:** Fukuoka, Japan

The representative director of Ryuubidou.
Ruka Kawada is a Japanese composer, orchestrator and keyboard player from Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan.
